item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。日元创两年多来最大跌幅。特斯拉今年季度汽车销量首次增长。首次公开募股（IPO）市场正在回暖。以下是市场动向。【原文：Good morning. The yen falls the most in more than two years. Tesla posts its first increase in quarterly vehicle sales this year. The IPO market is picking up. Here’s what’s moving markets. —Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 沃伦-巴菲特出售 3.38 亿美元的美国银行股票，原因是抛售潮放缓
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）连续第三轮出售美国银行（Bank of America Corp.【原文：Warren Buffett’s sales of Bank of America Corp. stock slowed for a third straight round, fetching some of the lowest prices since he began a spree of liquidations in mid-July.】

item.title: 中国股市突然大涨从亚洲其他地区吸金
item.description: 中国股市的强劲反弹势必引发全球投资组合的变化，因为一些投资者急于抓住这波反弹。【原文：A strong rebound in Chinese stocks is set to trigger a shift in global portfolios as some investors rush to catch the rally.】

item.title: 石笆排除加息可能性后日元下跌，日本股市可能反弹
item.description: 日本新首相称经济尚未准备好再次加息，日元因此创下两年多来最大跌幅，日本股市可能会因此反弹。【原文：Japanese stocks will likely rally after the yen suffered its biggest drop in more than two years on the new prime minister’s comment that the economy isn’t ready for another interest-rate hike.】

item.title: 日元暴跌后日本股市有望反弹：市场综述
item.description: 在日本新首相减弱了再次加息的希望之后，日本股市周四将反弹。由于有迹象表明美国可能放缓宽松政策，国债下跌，美元攀升。【原文：Japan stocks are set to rebound Thursday after the nation’s new prime minister dimmed hopes of another interest-rate hike. Treasuries slid and the dollar climbed on signals the US may slow its easing.】

item.title: 报告发现茂宜岛火灾由断裂的公用供电线路引起
item.description: 茂宜岛消防局表示，去年夷平了历史悠久的茂宜岛拉海纳镇的大火是夏威夷电力工业公司（Hawaiian Electric Industries Inc.【原文：The fire that razed the historic Maui town of Lahaina last year was caused when Hawaiian Electric Industries Inc. re-energized broken utility lines that caused sparks to ignite unmaintained dry vegetation, the Maui Fire Department said.】

item.title: 中东供应风险占主导地位，石油连续第三天攀升
item.description: 本周早些时候德黑兰发射导弹后，以色列预计将对伊朗进行报复性打击，交易商评估了中东的供应风险，石油连续第三天上涨。【原文：Oil rose for a third day as traders assessed supply risks in the Middle East, with Israel expected to make a retaliatory strike against Iran following Tehran’s missile barrage earlier this week.】

item.title: 芝加哥财政委员会推进 15 亿美元债券再融资
item.description: 芝加哥市议会财务委员会通过了一项 15 亿美元的债务再融资债券提案，这是布兰登-约翰逊市长为弥补美国第三大城市连续赤字所做努力的一部分。【原文：The Chicago City Council Finance Committee passed a $1.5 billion bond proposal to refinance debt as part of Mayor Brandon Johnson’s efforts to close back-to-back deficits for the third-largest US city.】

item.title: SAP 和 Carahsoft 的调查范围扩大到与近 100 家机构合作
item.description: 根据新的法庭记录，美国检察官正在寻求审查德国软件制造商 SAP SE 和技术转售商 Carahsoft Technology Corp. 与近 100 家政府机构的业务往来，作为潜在价格垄断调查的一部分。【原文：US prosecutors are seeking to examine business that German software maker SAP SE and tech reseller Carahsoft Technology Corp. have done with nearly 100 government agencies as part of a probe into potential price-fixing, according to new court records that show the scope of the investigation is far greater than previously known.】

item.title: 美国制导导弹击毙 6 岁女童
item.description:
杀害乌克兰平民的武器充满了美国公司制造的技术。【原文：

The weapons killing Ukrainian civilians are full of tech made by American companies.

】

item.title: T-Mobile 出售 5.61 亿美元无线债务交易八月搁置
item.description: T-Mobile US Inc. 在 8 月份推迟交易后，出售了价值超过 5 亿美元的以无线设备合同为担保的债券，当时债市受到经济、企业和央行意外消息漩涡的冲击。【原文：T-Mobile US Inc. sold more than half-a-billion dollars worth of bonds backed by wireless equipment contracts after postponing the deal in August, when debt markets were roiled by a maelstrom of surprise economic, corporate and central bank news.】

item.title: 前 C-Quest 首席执行官纽科姆被控碳信用欺诈
item.description: 前 C-Quest Capital LLC 首席执行官肯尼思-纽科姆（Kenneth Newcombe）被联邦检察官指控报告虚假减排信息，作为非法获取数百万碳信用额计划的一部分。【原文：Former C-Quest Capital LLC Chief Executive Officer Kenneth Newcombe was accused by federal prosecutors of reporting fraudulent emissions-reduction information as part of a illegally scheme to obtain millions of carbon credits.】

item.title: 期权专业人士称美国大选套期保值可能是最后一秒的事
item.description: 从某些指标来看，美国股票期权的波动性仍然相对较高，市场流动表明，虽然原因很多，但即将到来的总统大选并不是其中之一。【原文：Volatility in US equity options remains relatively high by some measures, and while there are handful of reasons for that, the upcoming presidential election isn’t one of them, market flows indicate.】

item.title: 海伦飓风保险损失预计达 64 亿美元
item.description: 根据灾难建模公司 Karen Clark & Company 的早期估计，飓风海伦造成的破坏预计将使保险公司损失约 64 亿美元。【原文：The destruction from Hurricane Helene is expected to cost insurers roughly $6.4 billion, according to an early estimate from catastrophe modeling firm Karen Clark & Company.】

item.title: ModivCare 通过最后一刻的交易避免违约 贷款人呼吁
item.description: 医疗运输公司 ModivCare Inc. 因付款迟缓导致现金短缺而从银行获得缓刑，避免了技术性债务违约。来得正是时候。【原文：Medical transportation firm ModivCare Inc. scored a reprieve from its banks to avert a technical debt default after slow payments left it short on cash. It came just in time.】

item.title: 副总统辩论在八大电视网吸引 3,900 万人观看
item.description: 根据福克斯公司公布的初步统计结果，副总统候选人蒂姆-瓦尔兹（Tim Walz）和JD-万斯（JD Vance）的辩论在八大电视网共吸引了3890万观众。【原文：The debate between vice presidential candidates Tim Walz and JD Vance drew a total audience of 38.9 million on eight major networks, according to preliminary results released by Fox.】

item.title: 中国，欢迎入党
item.description: 如果你把目光从美国移开片刻，你就会发现，在一揽子强有力的经济刺激措施的推动下，中国正在发生一场怪兽级的反弹。虽然目前还不清楚中国经济反弹背后的政策措施是否足以让中国经济持续恢复高速增长，但这些措施为以美国为重点的投资者提供了另一种支持。毕竟，美国市场和经济已经从其他刺激措施中获益，这些措施包括大规模的和平时期政府支出和前置性投资。【原文：If you look away from the US for a moment, you realize there’s a monster rally happening in China, fueled by a powerful package of economic stimulus. While it’s not clear if the policy measures behind the rally are enough to build a sustainable return to prodigious growth in China, they add another level of support to US-focused investors. After all, US markets and the economy are already reaping the benefits of other stimulus in the form of massive peacetime government spending and front-loaded】

item.title: 阿根廷在多年忽视后酝酿电力线路招标
item.description: 阿根廷正在加紧制定一项 "市场解决方案"，以建设全国高压输电线路网络，这是电网中被严重忽视的一部分，长期以来限制了发电量的增长。【原文：Argentina is rushing to put together a “market solution” to build out its national network of high-voltage power lines, a severely neglected part of the grid that’s long capped growth in electricity generation.】

item.title: 使用贝莱德代币作为抵押品更接近主流
item.description: 随着一批金融公司投票通过了货币市场基金使用指南，允许使用贝莱德（BlackRock）和富兰克林邓普顿（Franklin Templeton）等华尔街主流巨头的货币市场基金代币化份额作为交易抵押品的努力向前迈进了一大步。【原文：Efforts to allow the use of tokenized shares of money-market funds from mainstream Wall Street behemoths like BlackRock and Franklin Templeton as collateral in trading took a big step forward as a group of financial firms voted to approve guidelines for their use.】

item.title: 被指控的加密黑客一夜之间成为 TikTok 名人
item.description: 嗨，我是马吉。一名被指控的黑客在TikTok上声名鹊起 在那里，有影响力的人呼吁释放他但首先...【原文：Hi, I’m Margi. An accused hacker gains fame on TikTok, where influencers are calling for his release. But first…】

item.title: 道达尔能源公司称英国石油税将损害投资和运营
item.description: 道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies SE）首席执行官帕特里克-普安（Patrick Pouyanne）表示，英国计划进行的石油和天然气税改革将促使道达尔能源公司减少资本支出，并重组在该国的业务。【原文：Planned oil and gas tax changes in the UK will prompt TotalEnergies SE to reduce capital expenditure and restructure operations in the country, Chief Executive Officer Patrick Pouyanne said.】

item.title: 即使改革生效，货币市场基金仍受追捧
item.description: 货币市场基金吸引了创纪录的大量现金，尽管监管机构的全面改革给该行业带来了高昂的强制性费用。【原文：Money-market funds are attracting record amounts of cash, even as a regulatory overhaul pins the industry with costly mandatory fees.】

item.title: 如果没有新协议，Diamond 明年将放弃棒球转播
item.description: 钻石体育集团（Diamond Sports Group）的律师周三在法庭上表示，除非俱乐部所有者与破产的转播商达成新的转播权协议，否则该集团明年将停止转播美国职业棒球大联盟（Major League Baseball）除一支球队之外的所有球队的比赛。【原文：Diamond Sports Group will stop televising games from all but one Major League Baseball team next year unless club owners cut new rights deals with the bankrupt broadcaster, lawyers said in court Wednesday.】

item.title: 摩根大通称 PE 支持的公司 IPO 市场 "非常 "开放
item.description: 摩根大通银行（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：The market for initial public offerings of companies that are owned by the likes of private equity firms is picking up, buoying the outlook for such first-time share sales heading into next year, says a top JPMorgan Chase & Co. banker.】

item.title: 宝马排除投资 Northvolt 新一轮融资的可能性
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，宝马股份公司不愿向资金紧张的电池制造商 Northvolt AB 进行更多投资，该公司正在寻求新的资金以稳定其财务状况。【原文：BMW AG is unwilling to invest more in Northvolt AB, the cash-strapped battery maker that’s seeking fresh funds to stabilize its finances, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 施纳贝尔称欧洲央行不能忽视经济增长的阻力
item.description: 欧洲中央银行执行董事会成员伊莎贝尔-施纳贝尔（Isabel Schnabel）表示，欧洲中央银行必须解决欧元区令人失望的经济表现问题。【原文：The European Central Bank must address the euro area’s disappointing economic performance, according to Executive Board member Isabel Schnabel.】

item.title: 标准航空 IPO 募集 14.4 亿美元后股价大涨
item.description: 在飞机维修服务提供商 StandardAero 公司及其部分投资者首次公开募股募集 14.4 亿美元后，该公司股价在首次交易中攀升了 31%。【原文：StandardAero Inc. shares climbed 31% in the aircraft maintenance services provider’s trading debut, after the firm and some of its investors raised $1.44 billion in an initial public offering.】

item.title: 阿拉巴马学院在债券压力下与纽文达成协议
item.description: 春山学院是美国东南部历史最悠久的天主教教育机构，它与最大的债权人 Nuveen 达成了一项协议，使其有更多的时间来巩固财务状况并克服违约问题。【原文：Spring Hill College, the oldest Catholic educational institution in the southeast of the US, has struck a deal with its biggest creditor Nuveen that gives it more time to shore up its finances and overcome a default.】

item.title: 华尔街加密 ETF 热潮因首份 XRP 文件而升温
item.description: 在 Bitwise 资产管理公司（Bitwise Asset Management Inc. 成为首家申请直接投资全球第七大数字代币 XRP 的基金之后，华尔街的 ETF 搅局者们再次推动监管机构向大众开放加密货币的繁荣。【原文：Wall Street’s ETF disruptors are once again pushing regulators to open up the crypto boom to the masses after Bitwise Asset Management Inc. became the first to file for a fund that invests directly in XRP, the world’s seventh-largest digital token.】

item.title: 中东风险加剧，交易商押注每桶 100 美元石油
item.description: 周三成交了大量原油期权，如果价格回升到每桶 100 美元，这些期权就会赔付，这表明一些交易商正在寻求对冲中东供应中断的风险。【原文：A flurry of crude options that pay out if prices rally to $100 a barrel traded Wednesday, a sign some traders are looking to hedge against the risk of supply disruptions in the Middle East.】
